metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6571 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in Omnibox in Google Chrome prior to85.0.4183.83 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofing via IDNhomographs via a crafted domain name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6571` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
